name: Khamsat
description:
The khamsa is a symbol most widely known in Arab and Berber culture. An alternative Islamic name for this symbol is the Hand of Fatima or Eye of Fatima, in reference to Fatima Zahra, the daughter of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). An alternative Jewish name is the Hand of Miriam, in reference to Miriam, the sister of Moses and Aaron. Levantine Christians call it the hand of Mary, the mother of Jesus. It is a kind of "protecting hand" or "hand of God." While "khamsa" literally means "five" in Arabic, some associate the significance of the five fingers to the five books of the Torah for Jews, the Five Pillars of Islam for Sunnis, or the five People of the Cloak for Shi'ites. Recently, activists for peace in the Middle East have chosen to wear the khamsa as a symbol of the similarities of origins and tradition between the Abrahamic faiths. 

These khamsat are cast in bright and living color and are foregrounded against a haze of a folkloric semiotic narrative. The fingers can point up or down. You can ideally hang it in your bedroom for a splash of color or broadcast it proudly in your living room as a badge of your commitment to interfaith dialogue and peace.

This painting comes unstretched as a scroll on primed cotton canvas. It is an acrylic piece which measures in at a medium size (34.5 x 43") It was created with acrylic paint.

name: The Cool General
description: This bright, colorful, and eccentric painting is of a decorated general fitted in his military hat and standing erect against a starry sky. It is perfect for a chic apartment, a son or nephew's room or even for current or previous military personnel. Although generals and soldiers have become synonymous with war, weapons, and occupation, this painting utilizes bright colors and bold strokes to highlight the agency and humanity that each one embodies. It is painted on unstretched, primed cotton canvas and is a mixed media painting (acrylic, oil, india ink, gold leaf). It is a large painting measuring 36.5 x 45.5.

name: Konjo
description: Konjo | Helua | Piao Liang | Khoobsurat | Beautiful

name: Tres Ángeles Etíopes
description: A simple painting of three Ethiopian angels on recycled wood. The painting measures approximately 16 X 45. This colorful piece is done in mixed media and contains acrylic, oil, and high gloss gold finish on the wings. It would work well above a mantle, fireplace, or door entry. It is preferred that this painting is hung near an entry or exit, as these angels are sacred and in the Ethiopian Orthodox tradition, are meant to protect, guide and watch over us.

name: Lucky Elephants
description: An Indian inspired, colorful collection of approximately fifty lucky elephants. Perfect for that pop of color on your wall, whether it be a dorm room or a living room. This painting comes unstretched as a scroll and is 29 x 31.5.
